runs.comm: starts with a full ball outside off, tapped towards point by Ryder, who shouts 'Wait in' to his partner after playing that stroke
appeal for lbw, but that pitched outside leg, so no worries for Ryder, the ball deflects towards the off side
short of length, slight movement away after pitching on off, played towards backward point

after doing the business with the bat, Razzaq delivers with the ball now, he has Guptill tentatively poking at a delivery around off, takes the outside edge and Ahmed Shehzad pouches an easy catch at backward point
length ball on off, played towards midwicket by Brownlie, who is in his second T20
great start from Razzaq, just the leg-bye off it, the final delivery was back of a length and in the channel outside off, Brownlie blocks it off the back foot
begins with a tight delivery on off, defended to the off side
first poor delivery of the innings, sprayed way outside off
shortish and outside off again, not as wide as the previous one, but Tanvir was lucky ryder didn't get hold of that, Ryder gets a botton-edge as he flat bats that one, the ball rolls towards cover

and another huge blow for New Zealand, Jesse Ryder is gone, Shehzad takes another one, a far tougher chance than the one to dismiss Guptill, ran forward from cover point after Ryder's attempted scythe took the edge and ballooned to the off side, had to dive forward to collect it
Tanvir grunts with the effort as he sends down a fullish ball on offstump, punched towards mid-off
'Wait' is the call after another overpitched ball on off is eased towards mid-on

this is sensational from Pakistan, Afridi gets the direct hit from mid-off to remove Brownlie, who was attempting to get the first run off the bat in New Zealand's innings, third umpire was called for, not sure why since Afridi's pinpoint throw caught Brownlie at least a yard out
length ball on off, punched towards the off side

a huge cheer goes up as New Zealand get their first run off the bat, not exactly off the  bat even, Franklin tapped the ball towards point, and the fielder there produced another direct hit, the ricochet went towards square leg and New Zealand pinch an overthrow
defended by Taylor this time
length ball homing in on offstump, defended towards extra cover, 'No,' is the loud call from Taylor

the bad old New Zealand is back, Taylor is the man who is gone, Razzaq gets the breakthrough with a ball short of length that strikes Taylor just above the knee roll in front of off, massive appeal and the umpire lifts the finger, New Zealand struggling to keep their number of runs ahead of the number of wickets
another tight delivery from Razzaq to end the over, confidently punched to mid-off, cheer from the crowd perhaps since the batsman middled it
another cheer as New Zealand get another run through a no-ball, a full ball on legstump, clipped to the leg side

a full delivery outside off, french-cut  towards the keeper, just misses the legstump on its way, Franklin had started to go for the run before seeing the keeper field it, Umar throws but misses the stumps
NZ's runs overtakes their wickets, Franklin guides a ball on legstump towards fine leg to get a single
lovely stroke from Styris, overpitched ball just outside off, Styris doesn't bother with getting forward, he just thumps it through cover for four
back of a length, on middle and leg, blocked towards the leg side by Styris
full again outside off, driven crisply by Styris towards cover, straight at the fielder
keeps it full, on middle and off, punched towards mid-off to end the over
whipped towards deep midwicket  by Franklin for a single
short of a length and just outside off, Styris opens the face to steer the ball wide of slips and get a comfortable single
Razzaq keeps it steady, length ball on middle and off, defended

one more goes down, Franklin has his stumps re-arranged as he looks to send the ball into orbit beyond midwicket, he misses Razzaq hits, 67 is the lowest score in Twenty20s, New Zealand on course for a new record
Razzaq gets that one to move away after pitching in the corridor of uncertainty, has the batsman fishing at it, nearly nibbles it to the keeper
length ball on middle and off, solidly defended towards midwicket
full ball just outside off, driven solidly towards cover
slightly shorter, no room at all for Styris to work with, he skips towards legstump and guides the ball past slip towards third man
fullish ball well outside off, too far for the umpire's liking
back to attacking the offstump, blocked towards point
short and wide, gets the treatment. lashed past a diving cover fielder for four
defended towards mid-on by McGlashan
length ball on off to end the over, punched back to the bowler, who fields and glares at the batsman, Pakistan are pumped up here, and why wouldn't they be
full ball on middle and leg, tapped towards the leg side for a single
this one jags back a touch, the batsman adjusts late for the movement and clips the ball towards midwicket, zips through for a single
continues to be spot on, length is good and the line on off, blocked back down the pitch
length ball on off again, more forward defence from the batsman
'Catch it,' is the desperate cry as Styris charges down to a short of length ball on off and plays it inside-out towards deep cover, beats the fielder and lands just short of the rope
no cries of catch this time as Styris repeats the strokes, again over the in-field and powerfully hit over cover, no fielder had a chance, and those two boundaries have dented Razzaq's figures a bit
he starts with a tight delivery on offstump, batsman gets behind the line and blocks
shorter this time, and just outside off, batsman looks to chop that one, gets an under-edge towards cover
similar length but into the batsman's body, McGlashan jumps onto the backfoot and defends, hits high on the bat
again McGlashan is jumping as he dabs a fuller ball towards cover
Styris doesn't think this is a lost game, it was a short and well outside off, Styris mows that one powerfully over midwicket
back of a length on middle and leg, cramps up Styris, who defends off the backfoot
short of length and outside off, batsman gets forward and pokes the ball past point
that was a quicker delivery, very quick, Styris gets it towards backward point but can't beat the fielder
flat again, Styris looks to thump it down the ground, the timing is off, the ball rolls towards long-off

and that's another one, McGlashan pulled off some breath-taking reverse-sweeps two days ago in New Zealand's victory, today , like for his team, nothing is going right, the first time he tries the reverse he misses and the ball crashes into middle and off
short of length and well outside off, McCullum carves the ball towards backward point
into middle and leg, defended by the batsman
Styris continues to blaze away, he's 26 from 18 after launching another drive over extra cover for another boundary
slower delivery, rolls his fingers across the seam, it was well outside off, Styris didn't offer a shot, he was looking for a wide but isn't called
follows that up with a sizzling bouncer, 147 kmh, Styris was in no position to play that, he barely manages to get out of the way, and nearly falls onto his stumps doing so
now the slower ball outside off, worked towards sweeper cover by Styris
shortish ball on middle and off, McCullum comes down the track and confidently guides the ball towards third man for a single
length ball on middle and leg, clubbed towards midwicket, not far enough to get a boundary, batsmen settle for a single
played towards midwicket
misses out on the cut as he rocks back, the ball doesn't get up much
hit away down to long on
102 kph, he is continuing to fire it in, he was backing away and going for the slash, got it off the outside edge past a squarish short third man to bring up the 50
yes or no as the ball is pushed in front of cover, they decide on no in the end after Styris was half way down the crease, and got back just in the time with the dive as the throw came in
almost through him, it was fired in on middle and leg with the angle, he pushed outside the line and was hit on the pads, but that was going down leg
played down towards long on for a single
nurdled into the on side for a run
misses out as he gets forward and looks to turn this fullish one past midwicket, but is hit on the pads
cut away to deep extra cover
gets his man this time! he was walking across and outside his stumps to work it away square, missed and was hit in front of the stumps, that looked out and he is sent on his way
backs away outside leg to cut this in the air but past point for a single
goes straight on with the arm, and he plays it out to extra cover
goes back and hits it down to long off
slows it up, he rocks back but mistimes the pull off the bottom half of the bat to deep midwicket along the ground
Rehman dives and gets one hand to a punch from Styris, but cannot prevent the single
goes outside leg stump, Rehman follows him, Umar goes down the leg side too, but the slash eludes him as it rushes away fine on the off side
a full toss is swiped down the ground towards long-on
bowled'im! Made room to smack that into the stands, left his stumps exposed, was aiming towards wide long-on, missed and timber!

ripper, that was a quick one, fired in at 134 kmph and Southee simply wasn't expecting it, went through his defences as he tried to block it off the back foot, missed and we know the rest, that was 134kmh from Afridi
nicely done, fired in a quick one on middle and leg, flicked away to deep square leg for a single, survives
worked towards short fine
gets behind the line and blocks this one
big stride forward as he defends
crowd cheer as they think the match is over, but it was a bump ball that was caught by the bowler
fuller ball sliding onto the pads, clipped towards square leg
charges down the ground and scythes that towards extra cover, where Fawad Alam is very very lazy, doesn't bother bending and is nutmegged by the ball, lets it go for four
on the pads, worked to fine leg for a single
spins away sharply after pitching outside off, swing and a miss but his backfoot is in the crease so he's not stumped
and a repeat of the previous delivery, just a a touch closer to offstump, another heave connects only with thin air
defends this one towards the leg side

the googly cleans up him after a bunch of flighted legspinners, batsman looks to sends this up, up and away and has stumps re-arranged, clinical from Pakistan, 103-run win for Pakistan, that's the biggest margin of victory in a T20 between two Test sides
